CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 27, 1959, pg. A1 reads: "GOP Harmony Meeting - Republican nominees, defeated candidates, and those who withdrew from the May 19 primary race met the newly appointed campaign chairman, Harry R. Rowland, last Friday, in Carlton House, and heard pledges of harmony and all-out strategy for victory in November. Seated at a table and looking directly at the camera are Atty. John V. Snee, left, nominee for District Attorney, and Paul B. Rheinhold, the party's choice for Mayor.  Others, reading from left, around the table, and [sic] Representative Lee Donaldson, former Representative Atty. Thomas P. Greer, Arthur Wessol Jr., nominee for Common Pleas Court; Thomas Johnson of the Pittsburgh Pirates, and John T. (Harp) Vaughn, losing candidate for county treasurer. - Harris PHoto."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait, left to right: Lee Donaldson, Atty. Thomas P. Greer, Arthur Wessol Jr., Atty. John V. Snee, Paul B. Rheinhold, Thomas Johnson, and John T. (Harp) Vaughn, seated at banquet table in Carlton House for GOP harmony meeting
